page.title: 12SPECIAL EDUCATION-GENERAL
page.content: The 1944 Education Act stated that multi_handicapped blind children should receive a better education . Following this,Condover Hall was opened as a school for such children in 1947,by the RNIB (Royal National Institute for the Blind).Later in 1952 a new'Deaf Blind'unit known as "Pathways"was added,and extra houses were built to house the blind children in 1959.Later in 1970,8 new family units were opened by HRH Princess Margaret.The duty teachers at the blind school start work at 7.00 am and finish at 10.15 pm daily.They help the blind children wash, dress and eat. There is a special lift to get the children into the bath . Children come from all over the British Isles between the ages of 13 and 20.There are now approx. 100 pupils.
